impact-statement: Pair-rule genes in the wasp <italic>Nasonia</italic> function as in <italic>Drosophila</italic> in patterning anterior segments, and similar to ancestral insects in patterning posterior segments, illustrating a mixed-mode transition state between short and long germ embryogenesis.
